messages.message: For confidence validations, is there a way to pass in a decimal value?

currently no

is this a requirement for your use case?
client feature request, i'll go ahead create a jira then.
Is that level of precision something we have on the backend (and how reliable is it) cc: @lydia
so theyâ€™re asking for something like 95.3% confidence?
or to add an decimal instead of an integer (i.e. 0.95)
I can ask the client; I think 95.3 makes more sense. 0.95 is easier for a double/float variable.
they really need that level of granularity?
while waiting for them to reply, i think they wanted something like this compared to the traditional platform.

> they really need that level of granularity?
I can't speak for this customer, but I've definitely encountered situations where this level of granularity (at least a tens digit) was needed.

In the legacy platform, the lower a model's ECE, the closer together the range of confidence scores.  I've seen times where wrong values would tend to have confidences in the low end of 95.x% and correct values would start having confidences in the high end of 95.x%.

Even with LLMs, I've seen very specific prompts bring up the overall confidence levels, and even wrong values had confidences in the high 9x.x%s.  Though, that project's accuracy requirements weren't as strict, so we didn't need to analyze a lot of results and draw a fine line on the confidence validation.  I can see a need for other Build projects to get more precise.
